intro: Puebloa bradyi, commonly known as the Sonoran desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the Sonoran Desert in the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments. The plant features showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in harsh conditions. Puebloa bradyi plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for various desert organisms.
